```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
scene.width = 700
scene.height = 400

# Cyber Input Variable Mapping
Height_I = 5

def setup_scene():
    global ball, ground, h, v0, g, dt
    
    h = Height_I
    v0 = 10
    g = 9.81
    dt = 0.01
    
    scene.autoscale = False
    scene.range = 15
    
    ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, h, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.blue, make_trail=True)
    ground = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)

def reset_scene():
    ball.pos = vector(0, h, 0)
    ball.velocity = vector(v0, 0, 0)

def update_scene():
    while ball.pos.y >= 0:
        rate(100)
        ball.velocity.y -= g * dt
        ball.pos += ball.velocity * dt
        
        if ball.pos.y <= 0:
            ball.velocity.y = -0.9 * ball.velocity.y

setup_scene()
while True:
    reset_scene()
    update_scene()
```

This code sets up a VPython animation to illustrate the horizontal projectile motion of a ball launched from a height \( h \) with an initial velocity \( v_0 \) and bouncing on the ground. The animation will rerun whenever the value of the variable Height_I changes, starting with the updated height.
